div.h4: WMU School is officially closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. Please read Superintendent Maederâs letter to the community below.
div.p: Communication will continue via text and website.

div.p: We are willing to deliver meals to students/kids on Winfield bus routes. This will be to kids with no transport or access to get to our feeding sites. If you would like a meal delivered please contact Tracie Hartman 319.931.8446, or click the button below to fill out our online form.

strong.span: Â Â Â Â Â SUBSTITUTE CUSTODIAN

div.class: vc_col-sm-12 wpb_column column_container vc_column_container col child_column padding-4-percent

div.p: Permanent Part Time Bus Driver position is available with W-MU Schools.
Competitive pay and district-paid training provided. Position currently would be 3 afternoons/week. Great part time position!
Contact Supt. Jeff Maeder, 257-7700 x101 if interested.

div.class: vc_col-sm-12 wpb_column column_container vc_column_container col child_column padding-4-percent

div.p: Industrial Arts Renovation Advertisement for Bids

div.div:
Winfield Mt. Union CSD 208 South Olive Street Winfield, IA 52659 Phone: (319) 257-7700 Fax: (319) 257-7714
If you are having trouble accessing any portion of this website or its content please contact 319-257-7700 X 163Â for assistance.

div.p: The Winfield-Mt. Union Community School District offers career and technical programs in the following service areas: Agricultural Education, Business Education, Family and Consumer Sciences Education, and Industrial Education.

The mission of the Winfield-Mt. Community School District, through the combined resources of school, home, and community, is to guide, challenge, and motivate life-long learning in an environment that fosters individual success, mutual respect, pride, and personal accountability.

This is the policy of the Winfield-Mt. Union Community School District not to illegally discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, gender, disability, religion, creed, age (Employment only), marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity and socioeconomic status (students/program only) in its educational programs and its employment practices. There is a grievance procedure for processing complaints of discrimination. If you have questions or a grievance related to this policy please contact the districtâs Equity Coordinator, Guidance Counselor, 208 South Olive Street, (319) 257-7700 x153.
